summary_comment: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and genuine care for her students, making her one of the best instructors at OSU. Her engaging approach, passionate teaching style, and focus on student success are consistently praised. While some find her lectures in specific courses like Elementary Korean Culture to be less engaging, most students appreciate her kindness, humor, and effectiveness in explaining complex concepts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and genuine care for her students, making her one of the best instructors at OSU. Her engaging approach, passion for teaching, and ability to explain complex concepts effectively contribute to a supportive and enjoyable learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Professor Pyun is hands down one of the best professors as OSU and I feel very lucky to have her as the head instructor for my major. She's incredibly kind and funny, and genuinely cares for her students. She's lenient and good at explaining concepts you don't understand. She organizes the whole Korean program, which must be hard but she excells!

Ms. Pyun is a great person and truly cares for her students, but the lectures in Elementary Korean Culture were mind-numbingly boring. Many, including me, would show up and half-listen while completing other classes' homework. Almost all the testing content came from readings, so the lectures seemed pointless.

As a continuation of Korean 1101, Ms. Pyun was great in keeping students engaged with the language with useful feedback, cultural context, and a caring environment. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and will work with you if you need additional help.

With the Korean 1101 class, we had four professors. Pyun was by far my favorite as she showed a passion for teaching and taught in a way that allowed you to have fun while learning the basics of Korean. She gave great feedback and cares immensely for her students' success.

summary_comment: Professor Lee-Miller is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for her clarity and depth of knowledge. She consistently provides thorough answers to student questions and grades fairly. Students appreciate her willingness to help clarify concepts and correct misunderstandings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lee-Miller is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for her clarity and extensive knowledge. She grades fairly and is consistently available to provide clear explanations and assistance to students.

Ratings.comment: Lee sonsangnim is one of the best professors at OSU. She is very clear and very knowledgeable. Any question you have, she will always have an answer to it. She grades extremely fairly and will always help you to understand if you need clarification or make a mistake.

summary_comment: Professor Kim delivers primarily lecture-based classes that are very informative about Korean history and culture, making the subject accessible even to those without prior interest. While some find his teaching style and quizzes challenging, many appreciate his knowledge and enthusiasm, recommending the class despite its demanding nature.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim delivers very lecture-heavy classes, which some find boring, but he is an easy grader and highly knowledgeable, making the subject matter engaging for those interested in Korean history and culture. He is praised for his intelligence and helpfulness, though his high expectations and frequent quizzes pose challenges for students.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Kim's classes are very lecture heavy, however hes a very easy grader. If you enjoy learning about Korean history and culture this class is perfect. Personally, I greatly enjoyed it, however some of my friends who had no interest in learning about the topic thought it was boring.

Mr. Kim was a good professor, but his lecture style can be quite boring. I'm unsure if this is a fault of the material or his presentation of such, but regardless it made coming to class feel like a chore. He gives detailed quizzes, so be ready to remember the dates and small details from the assigned stories. I'd recommend different lit for GE req

Great and interesting time in class! A pretty lecture based class with some reading and occasional viewings, but nothing too crazy. Love Kim as a professor, he is knowledgeable in the material and is not afraid to show a bit of sass. Highly recommend, even for non-Korean studies students! Attendance counts, quizzes are not difficult if you study!

He didn't make study guides or tell us what the planned quizzes were gonna be on, so we had to guess. Having pop quizzes made this even more difficult. Take really detailed notes during his lectures, or you will not do well. The class was ok on an interesting-ness scale. The group project was fun, the class would be better if it was less quizzes.

Really great Korean professor. If you are minoring, majoring, or even just taking Korean you will definitely have him at one point. Incredibly intelligent and helpful. Out of all the Korean teachers he is the hardest grader and has the highest expectations of the students, both in language and culture classes.

summary_comment: Professor Yun is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, described as sweet and very enjoyable by her students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yun is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, described as sweet and very enjoyable by her students.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Yun is a sweet lady and very enjoyable to have!

summary_comment: Professor Kang-Parker is highly regarded for her kindness and care, making her classes welcoming and reducing student anxiety. She emphasizes daily study and active participation, which are crucial for success in her Korean language courses. While students appreciate her leniency and willingness to help, some find her teaching methods could be more engaging and effective.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kang-Parker is highly regarded for her kindness and care, making her students feel comfortable and supported. However, her teaching methods require consistent daily study, especially for speaking and grammar practice, to succeed in her Korean language courses.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely LOOOVEEE Kang ssn. She's so incredibly kind and caring and makes sure you feel comfortable. Honestly she has mom vibes. But don't skip class, you will fail.

Dr. Kang-Parker is an amazing Korean teacher! I took Korean for two semesters for fun and she really makes sure that you enjoy learning the language. A few caveats are that this class requires you to study the language every day as you would either have to speak the Korean in class (ACT class) or do a vocabulary or grammar (Fact class)!

She is an awesome teacher! For the class, be prepared to study every day. There is some sort of dialogue to memorize, a vocab quiz, or grammar quiz every day in class. It sounds like a lot, but you get used to it quick. This goes for K1101-1103.
Kang ssn is my favorite teacher. She does so much to help her students succeed. I always look forward to her class.

I've been a student of Professor Kang's for 3 semesters now and she is truly a great person who genuinely cares about students. As long as you have studied and are clearly trying your best, she will be lenient. She's always open to help, in or out of class. She's very kind which lessens anxiety during lessons. I'm happy to have her as my professor!

Professor Kang is a genuinely nice person and a great professor! She clearly cares about her students and wants us to learn as much Korean as we can. She's very lenient on the ACT grading, as long as you try your best. I found her explanations of grammar points easy to understand. She's always happy to spend extra time answering Korean questions.

Knag ssn is a nice person; she just does not know how to teach. The way she teaches grammar is by reading slides that you can find on the kleartextbook website. ACT classes, she doesn't know how to deliver what she wants you to say. Korean at OSU focuses on getting graded every day on speaking(anxiety alert) rather than learning Korean

summary_comment: Professor Cherry is known for being highly understanding and patient, ensuring that students who put in some effort receive good grades. However, her classes require significant dedication, with extensive homework and mandatory textbook readings, as she does not offer many opportunities for extra credit or leniency on performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cherry is known for being highly understanding and patient, ensuring that students who put in effort receive good grades. However, her classes require substantial homework and thorough textbook readings, with students advised that class performance alone is insufficient for success.

Ratings.comment: All of the Korean professors are fine. They're super understanding  bc and patient and as long as you put some form of effort in, you'll get most of the points. Just know there is a LOT of homework, and you will not do well in class if you don't do the textbook readings.

summary_comment: Professor Kim is an engaging and humorous instructor who excels at explaining complex grammar and encourages deep understanding. However, his classes can be challenging and sometimes intimidating due to his tendency to put students on the spot and his strict grading. Despite this, he is highly committed to his students' learning progress and offers support outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is an engaging and humorous instructor who excels at explaining complex grammar and encouraging student understanding, though his classes can be challenging and sometimes intimidating due to his direct teaching style. Despite occasional strictness and harsh grading, students find him personable and dedicated to their learning progress.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kim is a great instructor — he's informative, goes into more depth about complex grammar, and is proactive about answering questions. He's also really funny at times. However, his ACT classes are nerve-wracking. He isn't mean or anything, but he'll put you on the spot and doesn't really offer any help as you struggle to answer something.

Kim ssn is one of the few (Korean class) professors that truly cares about their students learning progress. Get ready to be challenged at his act classes! However, he is very helpful outside of the class. My advice is to ask him to explain grammar to you after class because the way he explains is very easy and clear.

Really good professor. Out of the four professor we had for this course, he was easily my favorite. Humorous, but makes sure you are learning while also being just a really personable guy. Homework isn't too bad, considering it's a language course and requires consistent study. Lenient grader.

Mr. Kim was an enjoyable professor-while maybe a little strict at times. He wanted his students to truly understand and embrace the concept of learning the Korean language. He is also a very humorous instructor and good at communicating answers. I really enjoyed having a class with him.

He is very funny guy. Love teaching his student i think...... He speaks korean with Busan dialect which is funny but he tries very hard to speak normally which is very good. I hope other student enjoy his class since it is very interesting and interactive.

Han Gil is a funny guy who cares about his students learning Korean. Like really, really cares. He sometimes grades a little harsh and is sometimes intimidating, but all in all, he's a good teacher. Also, if you get on his bad side, he might roast you in front of the class for not having a girlfriend.

summary_comment: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, making her classes engaging despite their sometimes lengthy nature. She is known for her lenient grading and ability to connect with students, making complex material accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise her cultural insights, humor, and willingness to help, though some note her quick speaking pace can be challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pyun is highly regarded for her passion and care for her students, making her classes engaging despite their sometimes lengthy nature. Students appreciate her lenient grading and her ability to make the material both fun and culturally rich, though some find her quick speaking pace challenging.

Ratings.comment: Professor Pyun is the best! Though her lectures can get long and tiring, you can tell that she really enjoys teaching and cares a lot about her students. She is a very lenient grader. If you go to class and pay attention, you'll get an A.

Professor Pyun is all-around amazing. I had her for both 1101 and 1102 so far. She provides a lot of cultural insight into her language classes. Beyond that, she's a great lecturer and she does her best to make sure her students understand what's going on. Speaks quickly, so occasionally hard to understand for those with accent problems.

Wow... Just a truly amazing professor! I was so impressed with how she made the class fun and interesting for all kinds of students. Both people genuinely interested in Korean culture as well Kpop-only fans can learn a lot of useful information from this class. Very unique, innovative, and just plain AMAZING teaching style. Highly recommend!!!
Pyun is absolutely awesome! She is very helpful, and you feel like you can approach her with any question relating to Korea. She helps you sound out the words if you don't know how to pronounce them.
She's my favorite teacher this quarter! She really cares about each student and she's absolutely hilarious. Anyone would benefit greatly from taking her class:D

her tests and quizzes are harder then ko, but you get used to it. she is more linent with the dialogues just as long as you are saying the right think it doesn have to be exact. overall it was a good class. im taking her again in the winter for a korean culture class.

A great woman and teacher! Her English is fantastic and she has a real understanding of a student's mind. I loved every class with her! She takes her job seriously but is kind all the way through! Take any class with her! She is also extremely helpful, utilize her!

summary_comment: Professor Lee excels in creating an engaging and inclusive classroom environment, quickly learning students' names and backgrounds by the second week. Her humor keeps the class lively, and she fosters a space where all opinions are valued.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lee excels in creating an inclusive and engaging classroom environment, quickly learning students' names and fostering a sense of community. Her humorous approach and respect for diverse opinions significantly enhance the overall learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Professor Lee has led nothing but a fantastic class. She was very welcoming of me and instantly noticed my late addition to the class even though she had 49 other students. By the second week she knew everyone's names and reasons as to why they may be late. She keeps the class laughing with her antics and values everyone's opinions.

summary_comment: Professor KO is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class easy and enjoyable. He is dedicated to his students' learning and provides ample support, though regular attendance is necessary for success due to frequent quizzes. He is also known for being an easy grader and flexible with assignments, fostering a fun and culturally enriching learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor KO is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class easy and enjoyable. He is committed to helping students learn, provides flexible grading, and incorporates cultural elements to enhance the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: love his class. Easy and funny.

took him for 3 quarters. he is a really good teacher and really funny. if you like the language he will make it easy for you to learn it. you have to go to class though in order to get the grade. if you dont go to class then you will miss the quizzes and you have at least 2 a week. but its not hard. you get used to it fast.
he's really cool. he cares about teaching you. He is very willing to help. He's cute too, in a nerdy way.
No Comments
He is a really great person! he enjoys teaching but give him time. It took a couple quarters for him to warm up to everyone, but he truly loves teaching.

He is an easy Professor and  very easy grader. If you do the class work, you will for sure get an A. He is also flexible at homework assignment and most of the time can make up any assignment missed. When finished, you will pick up more vocabularies and Korean cultures. He plays Korean movies, cute songs a lot as a way to keep it fun & interesting.
